title: Child Advocacy and Policy (MA) & Child Advocacy (Certificate) Webinar
description:
Become a voice for those who need it most  If you're passionate about protecting children, influencing policy, and standing up for those who need it most, our graduate programs in child advocacy and policy are for you. We're hosting a  webinar on June 9 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Online Master of Arts in Child Advocacy and Policy 
 Child Advocacy (Certificate) – Online 
 
 What you'll gain from the session: 
 
 Direct point of contact with faculty leading the program 
 Career outlook and insight from industry experts in the field 
 In-depth preview of your future coursework and what makes our curriculum stand out  
 Advanced understanding of the intricacies of the public child welfare system 
 Free graduate application  - we'll waive the $60 application fee if you attend the session!

title: Red Hawk Pantry
description:
Visiting the Pantry: 
 Please have your Event Pass, CWID and have a  PantrySoft Registration .  
 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided, however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Accounting (MS) Virtual Information Session
description:
This event is a brief 30-minute meeting for prospective students deciding which modality of our Accounting (MS) program to pursue. Those with an accounting degree can apply for the on-campus program, while prospective students from other academic backgrounds will be able to apply for the online program option.  Accounting (MS) - STEM Designated Degree Program 
 
 Accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) 
 Helps students develop strong, comprehensive functional and technical skills as well as a specialized, in-depth understanding of the complexities of current accounting, auditing and tax practice 
 Classroom learning is immediately transferable to the job and also prepares students to sit for the New Jersey CPA examination

title: Evaluating Sources
description:
Join our workshop to learn the art of evaluating sources. Learn to discern credible sources, spot bias, and assess relevance. Gain critical thinking skills vital for academic success and informed decision-making. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Introduction to Research by Drew Wallace 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14623996

Visiting the Pantry:

 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Gathering Your Sources: How to Use Library Resources to Find the Information You Need
description:
This workshop will highlight how to access different kinds of information through the Montclair State University Libraries, including books, newspaper articles, and scholarly publications. Perfect for those new to library research in a university setting. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14624021

title: Leggo Legos
description: Join SRA Linvia for a relaxing evening of creativity and fun! Take a look at the collection of Lego sets, choose your favorite, and build at your own pace. Whether you come solo, with friends, or meet new people, you can work together or independently on your chosen set. The Lego Movie will be playing in the background for anyone who wants to watch while building or just hang out. Once completed, take your creation home to decorate your space!

title: Cereal Cinema
description: Grab your favorite bowl and spoon for a cozy movie night with a twist! Join SRA Haydee for an evening of comfort food and entertainment where you can enjoy a variety of cereals while watching a great film. Whether you're craving something sweet, crunchy, or nostalgic, we've got cereals to satisfy every taste. Come as you are, settle in with your cereal of choice, and unwind with fellow residents for a fun and relaxing movie experience.

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost - $40-$50 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturdays, 05/31 - 06/21 
 9 a.m. - 9:45 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center Pool

title: Volunteer for Montclair Pride
description:
Want to volunteer at Montclair Pride? We’d love to have you on board! Montclair Pride will take place on June 14th in downtown Montclair along Bloomfield Avenue, and we’re looking for enthusiastic volunteers to help make the event a success. 
 We currently have three shift options available:  morning, afternoon, and evening. To sign up, simply fill out the form linked below. Additional details will be sent to you via email after registration. 
 Join us in celebrating and supporting our community — we hope to see you there! 
   
 https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIp QLSdo7WnbYfCwhL98Qt8UZjOF870YRpoDz_Pi5pXBl-C9FsvVyg/viewform?usp=preview

title: 8 Ball Pool Tournament
description: Join SRA Joshua for a competitive yet friendly 8 Ball Pool Tournament where you'll face off against fellow residents in exciting matches. Whether you're a pool pro or just learning to hold a cue, this tournament is all about having fun and meeting new people. Test your aim, strategy, and maybe a little luck as you compete for an awesome prize!

title: Annotated Bibliographies
description:
Learn about the different types of annotated bibliographies, what information is included in each type, and how to format your annotated bibliography. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/calendar/workshops/sprague123

title: Group X - HIIT
description:
HIIT or High Intensity Interval Training is an equipment free, full body workout that will get your blood pumping and muscles working! This workout keeps your heart rate up during the quick, intense bursts of exercise which are followed by recovery periods. This fun, calorie burning class will be a great addition to your exercise routine! 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required. 
 FREE for students/faculty/staff with Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Mondays, from June 16 - July 15 
 3:30 p.m. - 4:15 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Multipurpose Room 2 
 
 Instructor - Bella

title: Kayaking on the Delaware River
description:
Enjoy a relaxing day paddling down the Delaware River and learn some basic kayaking skills. Leaving from Montclair State University, NJ, this full-day trip will provide you with a chance to enjoy the warm, clear waters of the longest undammed river east of the Mississippi. We provide the boats, life jackets and paddles, but be prepared to get wet. 
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration Opens on  5/26 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340) 
 Cost for Students $10; Faculty/Staff $20 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 June 16, 2025 
 9:00 am - 6:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, bathing suit, towel, sunblock and a change of clothes. 
 Potential Hazards:  under/above water obstructions, rapidly moving water, poisonous plants/allergies, insect bites, unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration

title: Group X - Cycling
description:
Ready for a more authentic, more intense and less-stationary, indoor cycling class? The RealRyder is unlike any other bike because it moves with you, utilizing more muscle groups, burning more calories, and giving you a more authentic cycling experience than any stationary bike can. You won’t just feel the ride in your legs and lungs- you’ll feel it in your arms and core too. 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required. 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Tuesdays, from June 16 to July 15 
 5 - 5:45 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Multipurpose Room 2 
 
 Instructor - Bella

title: Teacher Education Program Information Session
organization: College for Education and Engaged Learning
description:
Join us to learn more about the Teacher Education Program within the College for Education and Engaged Learning! 
   
 Contact TEadmissions@montclair.edu with any questions.

title: Higher Education MA Virtual Information Session
description:
Become a leader in Higher Education   
 Whether you're already working in higher ed or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on June 18  at 12:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues. 
 What you'll gain from the session: 
 
 Direct point of contact with faculty leading the program 
 Career outlook and insight from industry experts in the field 
 In-depth preview of your future coursework and what makes our curriculum stand out 
 Advanced understanding of the intricacies of the current higher ed landscape 
 Free graduate application  - we'll waive the $60 application fee if you attend the session!

title: Crafting with Pride
description: Join us for crafts and snacks to celebrate Pride Month!

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost - $40-$50 
 
 Where and when?

title: MBA, Dual Degrees, & Graduate Certificates Virtual Information Session
description: Earning your MBA at Montclair is more than a credential—it’s a career accelerator. Our program is built to help you lead confidently, think critically, and solve complex business challenges. You’ll gain practical experience, strategic insight, and the professional network to move your career forward—on your terms.  Registration is open for our  virtual information session June 23 at 12:00 PM (EST) . Join us to explore our expansive programs and find the best program to meet your professional goals.

title: Master of Public Health (MPH) Virtual Information Session
description:
Protect Communities. Promote Health. Lead Change.   
 Our Master of Public Health programs position graduates to work toward advancing the collective strength of populations. We offer two concentrations:  
 
 Public Health (MPH), Community Health Education Concentration 
 Public Health (MPH), Health Systems Administration and Policy 
 
 Register for our virtual information session June 24 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. Graduates of our program are prepared for careers as practitioners and leaders in a diverse array of public health settings including: 
 
 local and state government 
 public and private health agencies 
 voluntary and community-based organizations 
 schools 
 healthcare institutions 
 policy and advocacy organizations

title: Nutrition and Food Science (MS) Virtual Information Session
description:
Fuel Your Future in Nutrition and Food Science   
 If you’re thinking about what’s next for your career in health and wellness, you’re not alone—and you’re in the right place. 
 Montclair’s  MS in Nutrition and Food Science  is designed for people who want to make a bigger impact—whether that’s in clinical practice, public health, food policy, or wellness leadership. 
 Join us on  June 25 at 12:30 PM (EST)  for a  Virtual Information Session  where you’ll learn how this program can help put your goals into action.

title: Skylands Manor Hike
description:
Come out for a 4-mile hike around a beautiful mountain hike in Ringwood, New Jersey. The trail follows Mount Defiance, and traverses along Shepherd Lake. This hike is a great view over the top of Northern New Jersey and a perfect challenge for novice hikers. Enjoy a short summer hike! 
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration opens on  5/26 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10; $20 Faculty/Staff 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 June 25, 2025 
 9:00 am - 5:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring : Comfortable Shoes, Water, Lunch, and Appropriate Clothing 
 Potential Hazards:  unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, insect bites, injury by running including sprains, lacerations, abrasions and fractures

title: Graduate Mathematics Programs Virtual Information Session
description:
The Department of Mathematics at Montclair State University offers multiple graduate programs in Mathematics: 
   
 
 Mathematics Education (MA) Online - Fully Online (synchronous) - 11 Courses to complete - Intended for future and current teachers interested in enhancing their understanding of K12 mathematics and related teaching practices. 
 
   
 
 Teaching Middle Grades Mathematics Certificate Online Program - Fully Online (synchronous) - 5 Courses (counts toward MA above) - Designed for current or future middle grades mathematics teachers, including current teachers in related disciplines (e.g., science, business, computer science) as well as in other disciplines, who are teaching, preparing to teach, or are interested in teaching mathematics in the middle grades. 
 
   
 
 MS in Mathematics, Mathematics Education Concentration - In-Person and Online Courses - 11-12 Courses to complete  - Intended for students who are currently teachers interested in enhancing their content knowledge, exploring current research-based pedagogies, or considering doctoral studies in mathematics education (we also offer a  Mathematics Education PhD program !)    
 Elementary School Certification with Subject Matter Specialization: Mathematics in Grades 5-8 Online Program -  Online courses - 5 courses  - Additional teacher certification program for candidates who already hold an appropriate New Jersey CEAS or Standard Certification in another content area. This additional certification entitles the candidate to teach mathematics in Grades 5-8 in all New Jersey public schools. 
 
 Registration is LIVE for our Graduate Mathematics Programs Virtual Information Session June 25 at 4:00 PM (EST) . If you're interested in understanding math on a deeper level, wish to learn new teaching strategies for your students, and grow as a professional, our information session is the perfect place to connect directly with the faculty in the department.

title: Social Research and Data Analysis, Data Collection and Management Certificate, Customer & User Experience Certificate Virtual Information Session
description:
Turn Your Curiosity Into a Career in UX + Data  
 At Montclair, our graduate programs are designed for people who want to use research and data to drive real change. Whether you're interested in UX research, social analytics, or data strategy, you'll find the tools, training, and support to help you break into or move up in this growing field. Registration is LIVE for our webinar June 26 at 1:30 PM (EST)   to get an inside look at programs that bridge human insight with data-driven decision-making. Why Choose Montclair? 
 
 A 30-credit MA in  Social Research & Data Analysis  you can finish in just 16 months 
 The chance to stack your degree with fully online certificates in  Customer Experience and User Experience Research   and  Data Collection and Management 
 Real-world tools like R, SPSS, NVivo, and Qualtrics—plus support through mentorship, job leads, and career coaching 
 Paths to roles in UX, market research, education, public policy, and beyond

title: Red Hawk Pantry
description:
Visiting the Pantry: 
 Please have your Event Pass, CWID and have a  PantrySoft Registration .  
 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Group X - HIIT
description:
HIIT or High Intensity Interval Training is an equipment free, full body workout that will get your blood pumping and muscles working! This workout keeps your heart rate up during the quick, intense bursts of exercise which are followed by recovery periods. This fun, calorie burning class will be a great addition to your exercise routine! 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required. 
 FREE for students/faculty/staff with Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Thursdays, from June 16 - July 15 
 5 p.m. - 5:45 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Multipurpose Room 2 
 
 Instructor - Bella

title: Group X - Cycling
description:
Ready for a more authentic, more intense and less-stationary, indoor cycling class? The RealRyder is unlike any other bike because it moves with you, utilizing more muscle groups, burning more calories, and giving you a more authentic cycling experience than any stationary bike can. You won’t just feel the ride in your legs and lungs- you’ll feel it in your arms and core too. 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required. 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 Tuesdays, from June 16 to July 15 
 5 - 5:45 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Multipurpose Room 2 
 
 Instructor - Bella

title: Library 101
description:
Welcome to the Montclair State University Libraries! This workshop will give you an introduction to the university library, including: 
 
 Introduction to scholarly sources 
 Library collections (including books, multimedia, and databases) 
 Finding full text articles 
 How to get research assistance 
 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Library 101 by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/calendar/workshops/sprague234

title: Kayaking on the Delaware River
description:
Enjoy a relaxing day paddling down the Delaware River and learn some basic kayaking skills. Leaving from Frenchtown, NJ, this full-day trip will provide you with a chance to enjoy the warm, clear waters of the longest undammed river east of the Mississippi. We provide the boats, life jackets and paddles, but be prepared to get wet. 
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration Opens on  6/23 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10; Faculty/Staff $20 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 July 7, 2025 
 9:00 am - 6:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, bathing suit, towel, sunblock and a change of clothes. 
   
 Potential Hazards:  under/above water obstructions, rapidly moving water, poisonous plants/allergies, insect bites, unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration

title: Discover Your Topic: Tools and Strategies to Help You Find the Perfect Research Topic
description:
Identifying and developing a topic is one of the most important parts of the research process. Join us to learn how to use the resources at the Montclair State University Libraries to build the foundation for an exciting research project. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/calendar/workshops/sprague345

title: Paddleboarding 101
description:
Join us for Paddle Boarding 101, a fun and beginner-friendly class where you'll learn the basics of stand-up paddle boarding. Drop in when you can and learn the basics including balance, paddling techniques, and water safety. All gear is provided — just show up ready to have fun on the water! 
   
 How do I sign up? 
 
 RSVP on Engage or just show up to the event  
 Free with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 July 8th, 2025 
 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm 
 Student Recreation Center Pool 
 
   
 What to bring:  Swim suit and a towel 
 Potential Hazards:  Water

description:

Stop by the Recreation Center and see if you have what it takes to win! Bring all your speed and have a chance to win the grand prize! Bring a friend and see who the real Wipeout champion is. You wouldn’t want to miss out on this splashing event, try not to WIPEOUT! *bathing suits encouraged*

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14675058

title: Wawayanda State Park Paddle Boarding
description:
Join Campus Recreation for the new and exciting sport of stand up paddleboarding! We will head to the Wawayanda State Park for a relaxing, fun day on the water. The lake is 1.5 miles long with multiple islands that can be gone around making exploring fun.  
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration Opens on  6/23 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10; Faculty/Staff $20 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 July 24, 2025 
 9:00 am - 5:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, bug spray, sunscreen, towel and bathing suit  
   
 Potential Hazards:  Unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration, allergic reactions/poisonous plants, and insect bites.
